intro: Caralluma kalaharica, commonly known as the Kalahari apple, is a succulent plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Nyctaginaceae and is characterized by its fleshy, spiny stems and small, clustered flowers. The plant is adapted to arid environments, storing water in its thick, fleshy stems. Its leaves are typically reduced to small spines, which help reduce water loss. Caralluma kalaharica is often used in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits.
